New Records: Rilee Rossouw scored the first hundred of the T20 World Cup 2022.
Rossouw and Quinton de Kock put on 163 runs, the highest partnership in the history of the T20 World Cup.
Rilee Rossouw became the second player to score back-to-back hundreds in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Rilee Rossouw scored 109 runs from 56 balls with seven boundaries and eight sixes.
Quinton de Kock supported Rossouw with a score of 63 runs from 38 balls.
South Africa posted a total of 205 runs in their 20 overs.
South Africa's captain Temba Bavuma was dismissed in the first over for just two runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Quinton de Kock expressed his happiness at seeing Rilee Rossouw back in the Proteas lineup and praised his performance.
